Class TreeListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • controller.TreeListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class TreeListener
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    This method will be the Listener for the JTree (on the left of the GUI) it extends MouseAdapter Class
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gurvan LORANS et Samuel LE BERRE

      This is the method extended from the MouseAdapter It will check if the user has Double-Clicked on an element and it will open a new Tab with information about this element if its an leaf

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This is the method extended from the MouseAdapter It will check if the user has Double-Clicked on an element and it will open a new Tab with information about this element if its an leaf

      • makeTable

        public void makeTable(java.lang.String nameOfObject,
                      int i)
        This is the method that will make a new Tab when Table element are double clicked The tab will be put at the i put in parameter
        Parameters:
        nameOfObject - the name of the object that has been clicked
        i - The index where we want to put the new table in the JTabbedPane
